qas.question: In what year were the Jews expelled from England?
What year saw the expulsion of the French Jewish community?
Along with Hungary, where did many expelled French Jews relocate to?
In what year were Jews kicked out of Spain?
Along with Turkey, France and Italy, where did expelled Spanish Jews travel to?

context: Jewish communities were expelled from England in <a0_0>1290<a0_0/> and from France in <a1_0>1306<a1_0/>. Although some were allowed back into France, most were not, and many Jews emigrated eastwards, settling in <a2_0>Poland<a2_0/> and Hungary. The Jews were expelled from Spain in <a3_0>1492<a3_0/>, and dispersed to Turkey, France, Italy, and <a4_0>Holland<a4_0/>. The rise of banking in Italy during the 13th century continued throughout the 14th century, fuelled partly by the increasing warfare of the period and the needs of the papacy to move money between kingdoms. Many banking firms loaned money to royalty, at great risk, as some were bankrupted when kings defaulted on their loans.[AE]
